name: ViewSonicLampFreeSmartTheaterAdvanced
0:
”Alexa, tell viewsonic to power off.”
”Alexa, tell viewsonic to mute.”
”Alexa, tell viewsonic to HDMI 1.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: viewsonic
des:
Support Model: X10-4K
Once you've enabled the skill, you can say :

(1) To power on/off projector, you may say:
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to power on."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to power off."

(2) To adjust volume of projector, you may say:
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to volume up."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to volume down."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to volume 0-50."

(3) To mute on/off projector, you may say:
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to mute."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to unmute."

(4) To change source of projector, you may say:
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to HDMI 1."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to HDMI 2."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to HDMI 3."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to Computer."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to USB C."
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to Home."

(5) To adjust focus of projector, you may say:
- "Alexa, ask/tell viewsonic to focus."

Troubleshooting:
(1) Unable to power-on Projector 
Possible Solution: Ensure that Voice Control is on. Go to Projector Settings > Basic Settings > Voice Control – select ON

Note: Please turn on "Standby Voice Control" in Basic Setting, if you want to use voice to turn on or turn off the projector.
